comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

windowblinds 7.0 (build 230 - Windows 7 Edition)

Just upgraded to Firefox 4 RC

Set menus to be shown.

Set windowsblinds to skin only Titlebar

windowblinds still skins menubar buttons and leaves a dark/colored halo on the buttons when scrolled over.

Have tried every possible setting with windowblinds only choosing to ignore Firefox and not skin it fixes the problem however the titlebar goes back to looking like classic windows bland grey/blue bar

Until the upgrade this did not happen

Reproducible: Always

windowblinds still skins menubar buttons and leaves a dark/colored halo on the buttons when scrolled over.

comments.raw_text: So this only happens with Windowblinds enabled? Can you check again when it is disabled?
comments.text: So this only happens with Windowblinds enabled? Can you check again when it is disabled?

comments.creator: jmathies@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text: could you post a screen shot?
comments.text: could you post a screen shot?
comments.author: jmathies@mozilla.com
cloud_firaga@hotmail.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 519801
scrolling over the menu buttons they become shaded and don't unshade once the mouse is gone

Yes checked when it was disabled. Problem wasn't there. As you can see from the screenshot I'm using ShadowFox Theme, and before you ask Yes I checked with default settings. I Believe that it has to do with the new "JägerMonkey JavaScript engine" Because I'm not 100% sure or not but I think the W.Blinds uses some sort of java for it's skinning. I'd start looking for the solution ther
